social_posts.post_text:
Such a great lineup at the @RidgeVineyards 60th Anniversary tasting. To learn more go to my profile and click on link to read new Forbes article. 
.
1964 Ridge Vineyards, Monte Bello: Fresh tobacco leaf and hints of tar with layers of sandalwood, cigar box and forest floor in the background that has well-integrated tannins and marked acidity, giving a mouthwatering finish.
.
1977 Ridge Vineyards, Monte Bello from Magnum: Smoky note that is reminiscent of lit charcoal, wild berries and graphite with blueberry scones and bacon fat with a linear body with fierce energy and lift on the finish.
.
1988 Ridge Vineyards, Monte Bello from Magnum: Hint of grilled pork ribs with added layers of smoldering earth, brambly fruit and tree bark with a textured body. 
.
1996 Ridge Vineyards, Monte Bello from Magnum: A lovely aromatic nose that is still so vibrant with boysenberry and black raspberry with allspice in the background that has intense flavors on the palate with lots of focused energy. 
.
2005 Ridge Vineyards, Monte Bello from Magnum: Redcurrant preserves with cocoa powder and upheaved earth with hints of fresh sage and slightly firm tannins that has lots of juicy fruit on the palate.
.
2013 Ridge Vineyards, Monte Bello: Ridge Vineyards usually re-releases their Monte Bello wines again onto the market after ten years, and so this 2013 is currently available on the market. This is a stunning wine, from the multi-faceted aromas and flavors of cassis, espresso, truffles and a stony minerality with plush texture that has firm tannins with racy acidity giving vitality to the intensely concentrated fruit along the extraordinarily long finish. Wow!
.
Rest of tasting notes in comments.
.
#Ridge60

Wonderful to taste a vertical of @Grahams_Port single estate Quinta dos Malvedos and the 2020 Graham's Vintage Port. Also, special edition bottlings of @Six_Grapes that have a special meaning. To learn more go to my profile and click on link to read new Forbes article.
.
1987 Graham’s Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage Port: Lit cigar with dried red currants with bay leaf and high acidity that has an expressive finish with notes of star anise and fennel fronds.
.
1999 Graham’s Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage Port: Lifted, bright aromas of eucalyptus and pine that is nimble as it dances on the palate with juicy cassis and vibrant red cherry flavors with fresh tobacco leaves in the background.
.
2004 Graham’s Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage Port: This wine immediately jumped out of the glass with an aromatic nose of dark fruit, cocoa dust and broken slate and if one thinks it can’t get any better than the nose, then wait, the palate is incredible with supple fruit texture, richly decadent body and an extremely long and flavorful finish.
.
2010 Graham’s Quinta dos Malvedos Vintage Port: This wine is extremely harmonious already at this relatively young age for a Vintage Port. Fresh mint on the nose with layers of stony minerality and kirsch on the juicy palate intermixed with bitter dark chocolate and spices with a lovely freshness on the finish.
.
More tasting notes in comments⤵️
.

Goldeneye @GoldeneyeWine has been bringing the world beautiful cool climate Anderson Valley wines for a quarter of a century now. And the beauties below are both lovely examples of how enchanting these wines can be.
.
2019 Goldeneye, Brut Rosé Sparkling, Anderson Valley, California: 63% Pinot Noir and 37% Chardonnay; made with the same sparkling method they use in Champagne. Aged in 100% French neutral oak for eight months. Pinot Noir comes from The Narrows vineyards which gives bright minerality and salinity due to its proximity to the Pacific, and the Chardonnay is from the Day Ranch vineyard which gives an acid backbone and overall freshness to the wine. Pristine aromas of river stones, strawberries and white flowers with hints of spiced toast and lemon curd along the creamy body with a long finish with tiny bubbles caressing the palate.
.
2020 Goldeneye, Pinot Noir, Anderson Valley, California: 100% Pinot Noir. Combines the estate vineyards of Gowan Creek, Confluence and The Narrows with grapes from the acclaimed vineyards of Day Ranch and Cerise vineyards to produce a multifaceted wine. Black cherry and stony minerality with a touch of cloves that has juicy blackberry fruit and silky tannins on the palate with hints of black tea and a distinctive saline minerality on the finish.
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #CaliforniaWine #AndersonValley #Chardonnay #PinotNoir #finewine #youcandrinkwithus #sparklingwine #bubbles #sparklingwines

I was able to experience a wine vertical that spanned 100 years by Château Le Puy @chateaulepuy. To learn more go to my profile and click on link and read "Wine Tasting Spanning 100 Years From Wine Producer Showing That Bordeaux Has Terroir". The tasting notes are below and continue in the comment section.
.
Château Le Puy ‘Emilien’ 
.
1921: Garnet color with orange hues, an energetic nose with bright notes such as red cherries and cardamom spice and an incredibly silky palate with broken earth and cigar box notes on the finish – delicate yet vibrant.
.
1932: Deeper garnet color with cinnamon stick and nutmeg on the nose and zingy sour red cherries with dusty earth on the palate.
.
1944: Similar in color to ’32 with aromas of dried wildflowers and toasted almonds with some grip on the tannins and dried herbs on the finish.
.
1949: This color was lighter than the ’44, with an exciting nose of crumbled gingerbread and bacon fat that has a linear body with tart red fruit.
.
1953: This was one of the palest colors with a delicate nose with subtle hints of forest floor, white pepper and black raspberry fruit on the palate with a fine tannic structure.
.
1957: Such a refreshing nose that is reminiscent of a walk in the forest after it has rained, with fresh basil leaves and savory spice on the finish.
.
1964: Sandalwood incense with crushed rose petals and ripe black raspberry fruit with sculpted tannins giving it lift.
.
1971: Interesting that this vintage could compete for the palest wine with the ’53. A very pretty nose with lots of perfume and sweet fruit such as cherry pie and cinnamon rock candy with a hint of cured meat to balance the sweet qualities with a round texture.
.
1977: Some youthful ruby hues showing in the color with fresh sage and thyme on the nose and a fleshier wine than the previous vintages with wild berry flavors.
.
1980: Mint and eucalyptus on the nose with dried blueberries and touches of morel mushrooms that has a real finesse to the texture.
.
1985: Fine sediment in the wine with more ruby hues showing in the color and leather on the nose with blackcurrant leaf with chewy tannins.
.
#wine #damewine #organicwine #naturalwine #bordeauxwine

Loved this thrilling Cuvaison @cuvaison_wine small lot series as Cuvaison is one of the original pioneers of cool-climate viticulture in Napa Valley as their estate is located in the Los Carneros section of Napa.
.
2019 Cuvaison Syrah, Diablo: 100% estate-grown Syrah. The name comes from the Diablo clay soils that are poor, reducing the yields significantly, and hence, creating concentrated fruit. Bewitching wine with blackcurrant compote with tobacco leaf and cracked clay on the nose and hints of graphite and black pepper on the palate with juicy black fruit that is lifted by an energetic drive across the sustained finish.
.
2020 Cuvaison Chardonnay, Hedon: 100% estate-grown Chardonnay. Hedon is short for hedonistic as it is by intention, a big and opulent wine yet it still has the high acidity that comes from cool-climate Carneros. An ideal balance of decadence and freshness with sliced golden apples with drizzled honey and lemon meringue on the nose with richly zingy quince paste on the palate with a creamy texture with lots of bright acidity.
.
2019 Cuvaison Merlot, Arcilla: 100% estate-grown Merlot. Vines planted on Arcilla clay soils that help the fruit retain its acidity but also allows the fruit to fully ripen creating velvety tannins. Deliciously ripe fruit draws you in with incredible flavors of boysenberry cobbler mixed with fresh red cherries that are highlighted with baking spices and crushed rocks with a supple texture and a long, flavorful finish.
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #CaliforniaWine #Carneros #NapaValley #Chardonnay #Syrah #Merlot #finewine #youcandrinkwithus

Alentejo in Southern Portugal has so much to offer to the wine world with a rich diversity of soils and native varieties as well as making Alicante Bouschet its spiritual home. The Roquette family has been an important part in helping the wine industry in Alentejo after tough times with their Esporão estate @esporaoworld. To learn more, go to my profile and click on link and read "An Imprisoned Man’s Resilience Keeps Hope Alive For Wines In Southern Portugal" on Forbes. 
.
2017 Herdade do Esporão ‘Torre do Esporão’, Alentejo, Portugal: Red blend of Aragonez, Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Alicante Bouschet from their oldest vineyards. An enchanting nose with raspberry tart, violets and stony minerality with an exquisite balance to this wine that will make it irresistible to anyone who tries it. It has finely etched tannins with a supple texture and nuanced layers of spice and pristine red fruit on the extraordinarily long finish. All finesse with this wine. Retailing at $300. A rare wine, as this is the fourth release, and it only comes out in outstanding vintages. The vintages released are 2004, 2007, 2011 and 2017. They have a special winery just for this wine and the Private Selection, and so, in years when they don’t make the Torre do Esporão, they will make the Private Selection instead. This special winery has lagares for foot-treading the grapes. They will launch 75% of the 2017 now and in five years, release the other 25% onto the market.
.
2021 Herdade do Esporão 'Monte Velho', Alentejo, Portugal: Red blend of 40% Aragonez, 35% Trincadeira, 20% Touriga Nacional and 5% Syrah. Rich blueberry fruit with hints of lilacs and blackcurrant leaf with round tannins with an overall harmony, retailing for only $15. .
.
2019 Herdade do Esporão, Reserva, Alentejo, Portugal: Red blend of 30% Aragonez, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Trincadeira, 15% Alicante Bouschet, 5% Syrah, 5% Touriga Nacional and 5% Touriga Franca; all from the Esporão estate vineyards that are 100% organic. Multilayered with red cherries, blackcurrants and warm blueberries with silky texture, and crushed rocks and cocoa nibs on the long finish with lots of concentration. Impressive at $25.

Château Léoville-Poyferré @chateau_leovillepoyferre showcasing some of their best vintages in recent times. More tasting notes in comments.
.
1996 Château Léoville-Poyferré, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux, France: 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot, 11% Petit Verdot and 4% Cabernet Franc. Smoldering earth, cocoa nibs and sizzling bacon with blackberry preserves and weighty mid-palate with slightly firm tannins that are fine in quality at this stage and warm raspberry compote over blackberry sorbet, very, very long finish with finesse and power. Impressive!
.
2000 Château Léoville-Poyferré, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux, France: 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot. Pristine red strawberries and white pepper with cherry blossoms and stony minerality on the nose that has a juicy body with a long, flavorful finish. At an exquisite stage in its life! 
.
2005 Château Léoville-Poyferré, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux, France: 68% Cabernet Sauvignon , 26% Merlot and 6% Cabernet Franc. The intense concentration, expansive palate and silky texture are not a surprise, but the crystalline quality of the aromatics on the nose and the finish is a surprise and breathtaking! Sweet red fruit balanced by tobacco leaf and forest floor on the finish. . 2009 Château Léoville-Poyferré, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux, France: 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 29% Merlot, 6% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Robert Parker originally gave this wine 100 points and it is in a stunning place right now. Jasmine oil, cherry blossoms and raspberry danish twist with plush tannins, fresh acidity and a lovely balance of richness with a clarity to the nuanced layers. Can’t use the word stunning enough!
.
#damewine
.

This 2019 Chappellet @chappellet_winery 'Pritchard Hill' Cabernet Sauvignon is brilliantly glorious! As some of you who are obsessed with Napa Valley wines from Napa Valley mountain fruit, you already know that Pritchard Hill is considered to be a Grand Cru vineyard by many, and the Chappellet family are the pioneers of this impressive vineyard that goes up to 1,800 feet above sea level. 
.
Complex bouquet with violets, cigar wrapper and blackcurrant leaves with mulberry tart and kirsch on the palate with supple tannins that has hints of shaved nutmeg and truffles; a dynamic wine that is deeply concentrated yet also electric with bright acidity and a mineral laced edge that has an epic finish. Wow, wow, wow!!!
.
#damewine 
.

There is nothing like spending time with those we love the most this time of year and sharing joyous moments with our community. And these beautiful sparkling wines from Argyle @argylewinery are a wonderful way to celebrate!
.
Many of you might have heard about the great quality of sparkling wines coming out of Willamette Valley in Oregon. Well, Argyle is one of the pioneers in making outstanding traditional sparkling wines since 1987.
.
2018 Argyle, Vintage Brut: 52% Chardonnay, 43% Pinot Noir and 5% Pinot Meunier. Impressively harmonious wine with pretty notes of lemon blossom, wet river stones and white peach with juicy nectarine flavors on the creamy palate. $30
.
2019 Argyle, Vintage Blanc de Blancs: 100% Chardonnay. Intriguing aromas of smoky minerality and orange peel with lemon confit flavors with lots of energy and drive on the palate that has finely laced bubbles and a mouthwatering finish. $30
.
2012 Argyle, Vintage Extended Triage Brut: 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay. Argyle's founder Rollin Soles was convinced by good friend Christian Bizot, 5th generation of Champagne Bollinger, to hold back a portion of Vintage Brut each year to make a special bottling like Bollinger's Grande Année. This captivating sparkling wine is like a siren song with aromas of honeysuckle and apple tart with hints of brioche, and the complex palate gives compelling lemon verbena tea and blanched almond flavors with a rich mid-palate and a long, long persistence of exquisitely delicate bubbles caressing the palate. $85
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #OregonWine @oregonwineboard #Chardonnay #PinotNoir #finewine #youcandrinkwithus #sparklingwine #bubbles #sparklingwines

Here's my tasting notes from one of my recent Forbes articles:
"$1,000 Bottle Of Champagne Demonstrates Bollinger As A Pinot Noir Fine Wine Specialist"
.
2012 Bollinger @champagne_bollinger 'La Côte aux Enfants' Champagne: 100% single vineyard Pinot Noir from the Grand Cru village of Aÿ ; north side of this vineyard. Roasted hazelnuts, dried lilacs and honeysuckle on the nose and flavors of cranberry tart and baked golden apples with hints of cinnamon stick caresses the palate with a creamy texture, and on the finish, the crisp freshness is pure magic when it combines with the fine, tiny bubbles that sensually glide along the mouth; a breathtaking balance of deep concentration and overall elegance. Only 1,000 bottles made; suggested retail price is $1,000.
.
2016 Bollinger 'La Côte aux Enfants' Côteaux Champenois Rouge: A red still wine made from 100% single vineyard Pinot Noir from the Grand Cru village of Aÿ; south side of this vineyard. 2/3 of the grapes were destemmed and 1/3 were not destemmed. Pretty floral notes with ripe red cherries and anise seeds with forest floor and a touch of morel mushrooms with an overall charming quality with lots of chalky minerality on the finish.
.
More tasting notes in the comments⤵️
.
#damewine
.
@champagne_officiel #Champagne #France #bubbles #sparkling #wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #PinotNoir #finewine #youcandrinkwithus #sparklingwine #sparklingwines

Bertani @cantine_bertani, Amarone della Valpolicella Classico vertical led by winemaker Andrea Lonardi.
.
1967: High-toned red fruit with zingy cranberry, saline minerality, a bolt of iron with dried red cherries on the palate with intense energy and marked acidity with an overall lightness of being.
.
1975: Crushed rocks, lit incense sticks and rosebud aromatics that expand in the mouth with savory flavors of dried oregano and truffles with lots of volume on the body.
.
1987: Vibrant right off the bat with a complex mixture of tar and crushed black cherries with a slight grip on the tannins balanced by good flesh on the mid-palate with a long, expressive finish with fresh flowers and baking spices.
.
1998: Pristine blackberry fruit, cocoa nibs and star anise with a broad palate and fully integrated tannins with juicy black fruit on the finish.
.
2000: Enchanting floral nose with pretty notes of cinnamon and nutmeg with a mineral backbone giving notes of broken limestone with round tannins.
.
2005: A perfumed nose with charming red fruit and crumbly chalk aromas with a touch of smoky minerality with black tea leaves and a linear body with lots of drive on the long, expressive finish.
.
2011: Sweet tobacco leaf and dried smoked cherries with blackcurrant strudel and fresh leather with lots of structure, freshness and ample tannins that will give this wine a ridiculously long life.
.
2012: The purity of fruit is stunning with red raspberries and wild mulberries with pretty violet and pressed rose petal notes and a saline minerality in the background with finely etched tannins. Extremely elegant.
.
#damewine
.

Happy Holidays & Merry Christmas from Penang, Malaysia!
.
This is a place we have wanted to go to for decades! We love Southeast Asian street food and this is considered the mecca by many! So much diversity, flavors and beautiful people that are made better by the multitude of cultures that surround them. 
.
We are already in love and it is just the beginning!
.
#damewine 
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #food #foodlovers #foodlover #southeastasianfood #southeastasia

social_posts.post_text:
The famous Blue Mansion (Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion) in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. 
.
A lot of history as well as featured in many movies such as Indochine and Crazy Rich Asians.
.
#damewine
.

location.city_name: Sungai Pinang Food Court Paradise 檳榔河飲食天堂

social_posts.post_text:
We went out of our way to go to a neighborhood with only locals here in Penang, Malaysia to eat at an open-air hawker center. 
.
This place was amazing! They had big air conditioners inside even though it was open-air and such a great vibe!
.
We got Sambal Stingray, Flamed Scorched Chicken Wings, Sambal Winged Beans and Sauteed Lettuce that was just a vehicle for all the Garlic Goodness in that dish!!!
.
Such a great dinner as everything was insanely tasty and there was a fun, relaxed energy in the air.
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #food #foodlovers #foodlover #southeastasianfood #southeastasia

Tropical Spice Garden in Malaysia!!!
.
My love is very passionate about tropical plants and so he is in heaven! There is something so relaxing about being surrounded by so many tropical plants. 
.
Also, we were able to swing above the forest 😍
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #southeastasia #tropical #tropicalplants #tropicalplantsofinstagram #tropicalforest #tropicalforests

We had lunch at what would be considered a typical cafe here in Penang, Malaysia, and we got the must dish, which is laksa. Originating from Peranakan cuisine, laksa recipes are commonly served in Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore.
.
The Penang Malay 'Assam Laksa' is a tamarind-based laksa including shredded fish, normally mackerel (ikan kembung), and finely sliced vegetables including cucumber, onions, red chillies, pineapple, mint leaves, laksa leaves and shredded torch ginger flower.
.
You can choose to buy spring rolls to dip them into the Assam Laksa. We also bought some treats made from coconut and pandan called kuih talam and kuih kosui - the one with the shredded coconut.
.
The place is called Wan Dao Tou in the Taman Emas food complex area - the name doesn't come up on Instagram.
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #food #foodlovers #foodlover #southeastasianfood #southeastasia

We fell in love with Peranakan/Nyonya food years ago, and so, nice to finally have it in Penang, Malaysia, after having it in Singapore as well as our home in New York City.
.
Peranakan/Nyonya cuisine comes from the Peranakans, descendants of early Chinese migrants who settled in Penang, Malacca, Singapore and Indonesia, inter-marrying with local Malays.
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic  #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #food #foodlovers #foodlover #southeastasianfood #southeastasia #peranakanfood #nyonyakuih #nyonyafood

Such a cool experience to visit the Pinang Peranakan Mansion in George Town, Penang, Malaysia!!!
.
It is a museum dedicated to Penang's Peranakan heritage. The museum itself is housed within a distinctive green-hued mansion at Church Street, George Town, which once served as the residence and office of a 19th-century Chinese tycoon, Chung Keng Quee.
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #southeastasia

We went to check out one of the Jetties in Penang called Chew Jetty. It is one of six wooden Clan Jetties in George Town, Penang, on the water. These jetties have some tourist gift stores but also people really live in them and as you walk by on the boardwalk you can see them right there cleaning, walking tv, ect.. It is currently inhabited by members of Penang’s Chinese immigrant community. 
.
Across the street we went to the food hawker center to grab some more street food. Funny enough, the local government built this complex hoping to attract more tourists so they would spend money at the gift shops helping the immigrants, but it has ultimately become a popular local hangout with live music and a fantastic energy.
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic  #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #food #foodlovers #foodlover #southeastasianfood #southeastasia

social_posts.post_text:
We have visited a lot of temples around the world but never one with as many plants around as Kek Lok Si Temple in Penang, Malaysia. One of the most serene we have visited and it tops the list as one of our favorites!
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #southeastasia

We just visited the Chinese Clan House Leong San Tong Khoo Kongsi, or Khoo Kongsi for short, in Penang, which is one of the most distinctive Chinese clan houses in Malaysia that has a lineage that can be traced back 650 years ago.
.
All I got to say is DAMN! 😮
.
#damewine
.
#travel #travellover #travellovers #instapic #travelphotography #travelgram #Malaysia #Penang #southeastasia

Cabernet Sauvignon from the esteemed Red Mountain wine region in Washington State in the house! Woot! Woot!

.

2019 Canvasback @CanvasbackWine, Red Mountain, Cabernet Sauvignon, Washington: 84% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Merlot, 7% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. Blackcurrant and rhubarb tart with a smoky minerality on the nose with a lush body that has finely chiseled tannins and hints of roasted nutmeg almonds with bright acidity on the lifted finish. $44

.

Also, Canvasback has a lower priced option called Greenwing coming from the wider Columbia Valley region which include the sub-regions of Red Mountain and the famous Walla Walla. This wine is blended across sub-regions to create a wine that is irresistible in its youth.

.

2020 Greenwing, Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Washington: 78% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Merlot and 5% Syrah. Pretty aromas of red cherries, violets, crushed rocks and cinnamon sticks. So, so pretty that it makes you forget yourself and you take too big of a gulp 😲 Soft texture on the palate with juicy cassis fruit and hints of fresh strawberries and basil leaves - a refreshingly delectable wine. $30

.
#damewine
.

Wonderful experience to taste the amazing 2013 Barolo vintage with five single vineyard cru wines as well as a single vineyard cru from 1996. And lovely balance and complexity with the 2012 Barolo Riserva and we kicked it off with an enchanting Gavi. All from the largest family owned winery in the Langhe province, Beni di Batasiolo  @batasiolovini. To learn more, go to my profile and click on link to read my latest article on Forbes: "Truffle Hunt With Italian Wine Producer In New York City’s Central Park"
.
2013 Beni di Batasiolo, Brussia Vigneto Bofani, Barolo: 100% Nebbiolo. A pretty nose with pressed rose petals and black licorice with a hint of tar adds to the complexity of the aromas and a slight grip to the tannins mid-palate, yet the finish has lots of finesse.
 .
2013 Beni di Batasiolo, Brunate, Barolo: 100% Nebbiolo. Complex nose from the start with crushed rocks, wild mushrooms and fresh leather with a silky texture and round palate with lots of fleshy cassis fruit.
 .
2013 Beni di Batasiolo, Cerequio, Barolo: 100% Nebbiolo. Enchanting nose with lilacs, baking spices and crushed white pepper that has bright red cherries on the palate intermixed with a chalky minerality and sculpted tannins that suggest that it will make great old bones.   
 .
2013 Beni di Batasiolo, Boscareto, Barolo: 100% Nebbiolo. Deliciously generous with red currant chutney over blackberry cobbler balanced by notes of fresh basil leaves and cracked black pepper with big, broad tannins that finished with incense and dried flower aromas.
 .
2013 Beni di Batasiolo, Briccolina, Barolo: 100% Nebbiolo. Concentrated dried red cherries with dusty earth and sweet tobacco leaf on the nose that opens up with juicy fruit on the full-bodied palate with mouthwatering acidity.
 .
The following is the same vineyard yet from 1996, and hence, 17 years older.
.
1996 Beni di Batasiolo, Briccolina, Barolo: 100% Nebbiolo. Enticing nose of truffle and grilled lamb makes this wine irresistible, with still lots of fresh fruit and vitality with jasmine tea and tar dancing across the seamlessly integrated tannins.
.
More tasting notes in comments⤵️
.
#damewine
.
#wine #wines #Barolo

So excited to finally try this MacRostie @MacRostieWinery Nightwing Vineyard Chardonnay! A highly anticipated debut wine!!
.
Winemaker, Heidi Bridenhagen, who has been continuing Steve MacRostie's mission to establish a vineyard program that would make some of the best Chardonnay and Pinot Noir wines in California, has been working on the Nightwing Vineyard project for years.
.
Heidi designed the vineyard from the ground up with selection of the ideal clones and rootstocks of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay for this special site that reaches up to 1,400 feet in elevation, as well as having it divided into 35 different blocks to express the various nuances of this lovely vineyard.
.
2020 MacRostie, Nightwing Vineyard Chardonnay. Petaluma Gap, Sonoma County: 100% Chardonnay. The nose entices with a saline minerality with citrus blossom and salty almonds that completely seduces on the palate with juicy mango and zingy lime juice with hints of honeycomb that finishes with lots of bright acidity.
.
2020 MacRostie, Day Ranch Pinot Noir, Anderson Valley: 100% Pinot Noir. There is nothing like tasting a top vineyard in Anderson Valley when it comes to experiencing an incredibly elegant Pinot Noir with lots of finesse such as this wine. Aromatically enchanting nose with pristine red cherries, pretty lilacs and cinnamon stick with blackberry tart flavors with fresh tree bark and a stunningly long, beautiful length on the finish.
.
2019 MacRostie, Sparkling Brut, Sonoma County: 56% Chardonnay from Sangiacomo Kiser B and 44% Pinot Noir from Thale's Vineyard Block F1. Freshly made brioche and spiced toast with white flowers with juicy lemon flavors intermixed with richer dried pineapple notes that has delicate bubbles that caress the palate. (Scroll to next picture to see it.)
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #CaliforniaWine #Sonoma #AndersonValley #PinotNoir #Chardonnay #finewine #youcandrinkwithus

Despite it forecasted to get very cold tomorrow here in New York City, 8F (-13C), I am choosing to drink an excellent California Brut Rosé Sparkling wine as I want to dream of summer!
.
Who else is with me?
.
2019 Cuvaison @cuvaison_wine, Brut Rosé Sparkling, Méthode Champenois, Estate Grown, Los Carneros, Napa Valley: 65% Pinot Noir and 35% Chardonnay. Stunning pink color with copper highlights and an intense minerality on the nose with warm raspberry fruit and orange blossom aromas that has a delicious strawberry sorbet flavor on the palate with zesty lemon peel and a fantastic freshly baked brioche note with fierce acidity that has a long mouthwatering finish.
.
#damewine
.

So fascinating to learn more about one of my favorite Napa wineries as I can always pick @FrankFamilyVineyards out of a blind Napa Cab lineup due to its elegance and overall finesse. Check out my new article on Forbes that talks about their background, "Former Top Hollywood Executive’s Napa Wines Display Qualities Of A Highly Successful, Classic Movie" by going to my profile and clicking on the link.
.
Also, below are the wines I tasted during the interview:
.
2019 Frank Family Vineyards, Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa Valley: 95% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Petit Verdot and 1% Merlot. Elegant from the start, with fresh black cherries, pristine raspberry aromas with crushed rocks and a deeply concentrated mid-palate with a round, inviting texture. 
.
2021 Frank Family Vineyards, Chardonnay, Carneros, Napa Valley: Slight hint of hazelnut and wet stones on the nose and vibrant flavors along the textured body with notes of peach skin, juicy nectarine and a touch of grated nutmeg with bright acidity. 
.
2020 Frank Family Vineyards, Lewis Vineyard Chardonnay Reserve, Carneros, Napa Valley, California: 100% Chardonnay from their Lewis Vineyard. Lots of acidity with an intense electric energy about this wine that is greatly complemented by a saline minerality that is balanced by rich flavors of lemon custard and hints of toasted almonds.
.
2021 Frank Family Vineyards, Pinot Noir, Carneros, Napa Valley: Lovely aromas of jasmine flower with red cherries and baking spices with an elegant texture and tannins that are like ribbons of silk with bright acidity and lots of finesse on the finish; Frank Family didn’t make red wines in 2020 because of the record-setting year of wildfires in California.
.
2018 Frank Family Vineyards, Winston Hill, Rutherford, Napa Valley: 89% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Cabernet Franc, 3% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot. Multilayered wine with rich flavors of blackberry preserves and black cherry pie with a sensual texture that is out of this world with complex layers of tobacco leaf and sandalwood with a long, flavorful finish that has that overall classic Frank Family characteristic of elegance.
.
Rest of tasting notes in comments⤵️

Bang for the Buck Alert!
.
The iconic California Duckhorn @DuckhornWine winery established their lineup of Decoy @DecoyWine wines in the mid 1980s so they could bring consistently balanced wines that always deliver the goods at a value-driven price to their customers, and the lineup below, Chardonnay retailing at $20 and the reds retailing at $25, certainly fulfill that promise. And they are able to perform such a feat by the mad skills of their winemaker, Dana Epperson, who finds the ideal blends among their diverse portfolio of vineyards.
.
2021 Decoy, California Chardonnay: 72% of Chardonnay came from vineyards in Sonoma County that are blended with other vineyards from Monterey, Mendocino and Santa Barbara. Aromas of lemon blossom and ripe golden apples with a bright acidity on the palate with lemon zest and white peach flavors.
.
2021 Decoy, California Pinot Noir: Blended across six counties with some top sites on the Central Coast such as Mission Vineyard in Monterey, La Estancia in Santa Lucia Highlands and La Rinconada in Sta. Rita Hills. Charming nose with ripe strawberries and fresh thyme on the nose and underbrush and juicy red cherry flavors on the palate with a fine texture.
.
2021 Decoy, California Zinfandel: 90% Zinfandel and 10% Petite Sirah; 68% of Sonoma County grapes are in the blend, with a focus on Dry Creek Valley vineyards, as well as head-trained, old-vine sites in San Joaquin, Alameda, Amador and Yolo. Very spicy nose with black pepper and curry leaves with a harmonious combination of fruit on the palate, blueberry pie and zingy cranberry, with a plush body and lifted finish.
.
2020 Decoy, California Cabernet Sauvignon: 90% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot. A blend of Sonoma County and Napa Valley with Paso Robles and Santa Barbara vineyards. Dark brooding fruit such as blackberries and black cherries on the nose that are highlighted by spices and tree bark with lots of generosity on the palate with mouth watering fruit and well-integrated tannins.
.
#damewine
.

Wonderful to taste this lovely lineup of @ColleMassari Wine Estates from Tuscany. that includes a couple of historic wineries. It was also a great pleasure to sit down with chief winemaker Luca Marrone and learn about his journey which includes some impressive mentors. To learn more go to my profile and click on link to read new Forbes article. 
.
2015 Grattamacco, Bolgheri Superiore, Bolgheri, Tuscany: 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 15% Sangiovese. The rich flavors of plum pie are balanced by the depth of complexity of cigar notes with hints of cured meats finishing with silky tannins and a bright cranberry note. 2015 is a great vintage that produced big, bold, stunning wines.
.
2017 Grattamacco, Bolgheri Superiore, Bolgheri, Tuscany: 35th-anniversary edition; Blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 15% Sangiovese. A surprising saline minerality to this wine with dried cranberry fruit and fresh herbs with some grip to the big-shouldered tannins that is ideal with a nice steak. 2017 was a hot, dry vintage.
.
2018 Grattamacco, Bolgheri Superiore, Bolgheri, Tuscany: Blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 15% Sangiovese. Blackcurrant leaves and fresh thyme on the nose with vibrant black cherry fruit on the palate intermixed with underbrush notes and a more linear body with lots of vitality.
.
2019 Grattamacco, Bolgheri Superiore, Bolgheri, Tuscany: Blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 15% Sangiovese. A seamlessly beautiful wine with delicious blue fruit such as blueberry tart and an enchanting background of aromas such as rose oil and lavender sea salt that has an incredible density and a long, silky finish.
.
2017 Poggio di Sotto, Rosso di Montalcino, Montalcino, Tuscany: 100% Sangiovese. Crushed rocks and fresh tobacco on the nose with a wonderful fleshiness on the palate that gives a round and lovely texture with lots of black fruit, finishing with savory spices.  
.
2017 San Giorgio, Ugolforte, Brunello di Montalcino, Montalcino, Tuscany: 100% Sangiovese. Packs a punch with tons of juicy, concentrated layers of red and black fruits with crushed rose petals and slightly firm tannins yet the purity of Sangiovese shines.

Wow! Wow! Wow!
.
These top level, outstanding @EmeritusWines from their stellar Pinot Hill estate vineyard in the Sonoma Coast's Sebastopol Hills are jaw-droppingly fantastic! And the eastern and western parts of this vineyard are drastically different but both enticing in their own way. 
.
2018 Emeritus, Pinot Hill Cruz:100% Pinot Noir from the A Block of the eastern exposure of the vineyard that is planted with cuttings from the legendary Grand Cru Richebourg vineyard in Burgundy. The second I poured this wine, it immediately started singing to me with vibrant notes of ripe raspberry, zingy cranberry and orange zest with cherry sorbet flavors highlighted with hints of saline minerality with mouthwatering acidity and a long, vibrant finish.
.
2018 Emeritus, Pinot Hill Elite: 100% Pinot Noir from the D Block that is steeply sloped to the west and planted with cuttings from the prestigious Grand Cru La Romanée vineyard in Burgundy. A completely different animal on the nose with deeper, darker atomas of forest floor, cigar box and broken gravel with wild blackberries and black cherry preserves on the palate with hints of cocoa nibs with a plush, textured body and a sustained, flavorful finish.
.
Wines like these beauties always thrill me as they beautifully balance generosity, elegance and vibrancy!
.
#damewine
.

The new vintage release for @OrnellaiaWinery
.
Also, to read more about why they named this vintage ‘La Proporzione’ and the special art labels created for it, go to my profile and click on link to read new Forbes article.
"Super Star Tuscan Wine Unveils 2020 Vintage, And Experiences, For The First Time, Perfection For All Grape Varieties"
.
2020 Ornellaia ‘La Proporzione’ Bolgheri DOC Superiore, Bolgheri, Tuscany: 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot, 13% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot. Many times it is not worth noting the color, yet the color is stunning on this wine with a pristine ruby color that has highlights of purple that has an enchanting nose with blueberry tart and black cherry compote lifted with floral violet aromas with a tinge of fresh sage that dances across the palate with juicy cassis fruit flavors laced with a saline minerality that has a silky, lush texture with lots of energy on the long, expressive finish.
.
#damewine
.
.

Do you like French Malbec? Check out the wines below. Also, to learn more about the below producer go to my profile, click on link, and go to Forbes article: "The Man Who Saved Cartier Is Now Saving An Ancient Wine Estate"
.
Château Lagrézette @chateaulagrezette is located in the tiny town of Caillac in the Lot department in South West France, and all of the wines below, except the rosé, may use the Cahors wine appellation in France.
.
2015 Château Lagrézette: 100% Malbec from the third terrace of the property with limestone and clay vineyards from 35-year-old vines. Vibrant with minty aromas and hints of fresh blackberries with lots of complexity with notes of leather, tar and lots of structure, giving it lift on the finish.
.
2016 Château Lagrézette: 100% Malbec from the third terrace of the property with limestone and clay vineyards from 35-year-old vines. A dark and deliciously decadent wine balanced by dried herbs and earthy notes with a silky texture.
.
2015 Le Pigeonnier: 100% Malbec from an outstanding isolated section of a vineyard that produces powerful fruit from 35-year-old vines. Opaque color with dark, brooding fruit that draws one into the glass with black cherry cobbler, smoldering cigar and cedar aromas along the muscularly shaped body with a very long and flavorful finish.
.
2018 Paragon: 100% Malbec from an exceptional vineyard known as Landiech with soils made up of gravel and clay from very low-yielding grapes. Charming nose of violets and blueberry fruit with layers of delectable flavors such as cinnamon roll and licorice with finely-laced tannins with an overall finesse. . 2019 Chevalier du Château Lagrézette: 100% Malbec from the third terrace on the estate in Kimmeridgian limestone from 30-year-old vines. Tobacco leaf and tree bark on the nose and juicy cassis on the palate with a good weight with an overall elegant shape. .
.
Rest of tasting notes in comments⤵️
.
#damewine

Such a beautiful experience to sit down with Ilaria Felluga to talk and taste her family's wines @marcofelluga_russizsuperiore. To learn more go to my profile and click on link to read on Forbes: "A Great Italian White Wine Family Loses Their Leader, Leaving His Daughter To Take The Reins"
.
Tasting notes of the wines are below
.
2021 Marco Felluga Winery ‘Maralba’ Ribolla Gialla: 100% Ribolla Gialla. Floral nose with tangy lemon zest and a good amount of weight on the body with a fierce minerality.
 .
2021 Marco Felluga Winery ‘Mongris’ Pinot Grigio: 100% Pinot Grigio. Juicy white peach flavors with hints of Brazil nut and honeysuckle with wet stones on the finish.
 .
2021 Russiz Superiore Winery, Collio Sauvignon: 100% Sauvignon. Bright nose with citrus blossom, saline minerality with fresh sage, and a touch of richness on the mouthwatering palate.
 .
2017 Marco Felluga Winery, Molamatta, Collio Bianco: Blend of Pinot Bianco, Ribolla Gialla and Friulano from the Molamatta plot. A complex nose of bay leaf, marzipan and white pepper with vibrant flavors like quince paste and a long, expressive finish with an enticing smoky minerality note. 
 .
2019 Russiz Superiore Winery, Collio Cabernet Franc: 100% Cabernet Franc. Right off the bat, a lovely purity of blueberry fruit with layers of pie crust, forest floor and crushed rocks with a soft texture and a long, expressive finish with notes of violets.
.
#damewine
.

Duckhorn Vineyards @duckhornwine was founded in 1976 and became part of the first 40 Napa Valley wineries, although it is a completely different world today. I am a fan of Howell Mountain Napa Valley Cabs and Duckhorn has been sourcing grapes there for a quarter of a century. Also, their Napa Valley Merlot is so elegant!
.
2018 Duckhorn Vineyards, Howell Mountain, Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa Valley: 92% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Merlot. Such a stunning nose - a walk in the rainforest after a downpour. Wild flowers, sweet tobacco and blackberries on the nose with cassis flavors with layers of cloves, broken gravel and finishing with jasmine on the extremely long, aromatic finish with finely etched tannins. Super star!
.
2020 Duckhorn Vineyards, Merlot, Napa Valley: 80% Merlot, 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot coming from various areas in Napa, and winemaker Renée Ary talks about the sourcing of this wine by noting, "Carneros Merlot brings super bright and polished red fruit," Rutherford bring "firm tannins" and darker fruit, Calistoga "offers concentration and Yountville "brings suppleness and plush tannins." My tasting note: Pristine black raspberry and blueberry notes with nutmeg and star anise that has cocoa nibs on the palate with blackcurrant leaves and hints of cherry tart with an elegant structure giving shape to the plush fruit.
.
#damewine
.

social_posts.post_text:
One doesn't expect anything else but excellence at Bodegas Macán @MacanWine , which is a partnership between iconic wine family Benjamin de Rothschild and the iconic wine producer Vega Sicilia @temposvegasicilia VegaSicilia , in Rioja, Spain. My visit not only lived up to expectations but they were surpassed in every way!!! Wowee!!!
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #Spain #Tempranillo #vegasicilia #Rioja #redwine #finewine #youcandrinkwithus @europvin

An exciting day at @temposvegasicilia Vega Sicilia's estate in Toro, Spain, called Pintia, pruning their incredible Tempranillo bush vines and learning how they are making elegant wines in an area that is known for their rustic wines by keeping yields extremely low, using indigenous yeasts, and now taking it to the next level, by using amphorae (vessels made of clay) for part of the aging of the wine. 
.
Also, as you scroll through the photos you will see David Velázquez, part of the winery team doing the blending, who is giving us three different Pintia wines from the 2022 vintage, one with 10% amphorae, one with 15% amphorae and one with 20% amphorae, just radiating joy - you know this man loves his job!
.
#damewine
.
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #Spain #Tempranillo #vegasicilia #Toro #redwine #finewine #youcandrinkwithus @europvin

I was blown away by Vega Sicilia's sibling estate Alión in Ribera del Duero, Spain. 70% of the blend comes from the historic, iconic Vega Sicilia's estate and 30% from legendary neighboring vineyards such as Pesquera.
.
Wonderful to taste a mini vertical (2019 is not released yet and that's why they had to write it on the bottle) as well as spending time in the magical Alión winery 😍
.
#damewine
.
.
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #Spain #Tempranillo #vegasicilia #RiberadelDuero #redwine #finewine #youcandrinkwithus @europvin  @temposvegasicilia

Here I am in a Vega Sicilia @temposvegasicilia vineyard planted in 1890! If it already wasn't an amazing experience to visit such an iconic piece of land of one of the greatest wineries in the world, it got that much more blown your mind 'I can't believe this is happening to me' when they allowed me to plant a new vine after a quick lesson of how to do it.
.
#damewine
.
.

The heavens opened and the angels started to sing... welcome to the prestigious estate of Vega Sicilia! We even got to go in the room where they are aging "potential" Unico 😃
.
It was a 'pinch me moment, I must be dreaming!'
.
#damewine 
.

Drinking the wine of kings and the king of wines in the vineyards of Tokaji, Hungary!
.
Vega Sicilia's @temposvegasicilia Oremus winery and vineyards where enchanting and otherworldly with their dry, late harvest and sweet (aszú) wines that are measured in what they call 'puttonyos'.
.
#damewine 
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #Hungary #Tokaji #whitewine #sweetwine #lateharvest #vegasicilia #finewine #vineyards #youcandrinkwithus @europvin

LIQUID GOLD!
.
You haven't lived until you have drunk the sweet wine Tokaji Aszú from Tokaji, Hungary! The wine of kings with layers of sweet fruit, intense minerality, flowers, truffles... Complex, decadent and luscious!!!
.
And when you go into the several centuries old cellars of Oremus, it is like being transported to the past, and they certainly treat you like a queen and king!!!
.
#damewine 
.
.

Always such a treat to enjoy the outstanding @Chappellet_Winery mountain fruit from their Pritchard Hill estate in Napa Valley with this newly released Malbec and Merlot. The Pinot Noir is an extra bonus and showcases how Chappellet likes to promote cool-climate areas such as the acclaimed Dutton family vineyards in Russian River Valley in Sonoma, which is where the wine is sourced.
.
And just look at that Malbec label featuring original work of dragon art by artist and second-generation family member, Carissa Chappellet. Such a fantastic label!!!
.
2019 Chappellet, Malbec, Napa Valley: 89% Malbec, 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Petit Verdot. Rich aromatics of espresso and blackberry compote with freshly grated nutmeg and bright, vibrant flavors on the palate with red plums and warm raspberries along the sustained finish. So fun and so, so delicious!
.
2019 Chappellet, Merlot, Napa Valley: 76% Merlot, 12% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot. Cocoa powder and smoked black tea with lit cedar and black cherry tart that has fresh herbs and juicy cassis flavors along the well-structured body. If you haven't had cooler climate Merlot mountain fruit then you are missing out.
.
2021 Chappellet, Grower Collection Pinot Noir, Apple Lane Vineyard Russian River Valley: 100% Pinot Noir. A nose that enchants with brambly berries and rhubarb pie with a touch of clove that is extremely silky and beautifully delicate on the palate with a long, expressive finish that makes you smitten with this wine to the point that it is hard not to drink the whole bottle.
.
#damewine
.
#CaliforniaWine #NapaValley #RussianRiverValley #Sonoma #PritchardHill #finewine #Malbec #Merlot #PinotNoir #wine #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #sommelier #vino #instagram #vin #amazing #beautiful #delicious #happy #youcansipwithus @napavintners

Really loved getting into the story behind @morisolivineyard and @elysewinery which is covered in my new Forbes story "Army Black Hawk Pilot Juggles Two Roles: 5th Generation Napa Valley Wine Grape Grower & Assisting Underdeveloped Nations"
.
Tasting notes below and if you want to read the story go to my profile and click on link.
.
2019 Morisoli Vineyard, Cabernet Sauvignon, Rutherford, Napa Valley: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from the Morisoli estate. An intriguing nose with crushed rocks, wildflowers and toasted anise seeds with a multifaceted palate that includes graphite and cigar box balanced by plush black cherry sauce flavors with velvety tannins that are finely sculpted to give an elegant shape to the long, flavorful finish. 
.
2018 Morisoli Vineyard, Cabernet Sauvignon, Rutherford, Napa Valley: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from the Morisoli estate. The slowly sauntering aromas are elegantly captivating from the start with stony minerality, blackcurrant leaf and a faint touch of violets that enchants the palate with a beautiful texture reminiscent of delicate lace that gently caresses along the long, expressive finish. 
.
2019 Elyse, Zinfandel, Morisoli Vineyard, Rutherford, Napa Valley: 100% Zinfandel from Zieger block on the Morisoli estate. Rhubarb compote, red cherry tart and a touch of black pepper in the background with a lush texture and lovely balance between earthy and fruit-driven notes on the palate. Delicious! 
.
#damewine
.
#CaliforniaWine #NapaValley #finewine #CabernetSauvignon #Zinfandel #wine #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #sommelier #vino #instagram #vin #amazing #beautiful #delicious #happy #youcansipwithus @napavintners

These @MigrationWine Sonoma Coast beauties are mainly sourced from their dry-farmed estate vineyard, Running Creek Vineyard, in Russian River Valley.
.
The below Chardonnay is also sourced from top single vineyards along the Sonoma Coast: Dutton family's Jewell Vineyard in Green Valley, the Sangiacomo family's Kiser Vineyard in Carneros and the famed Keefer Ranch in the coolest part of Green Valley.
.
2021 Migration, Sonoma Coast Chardonnay, California: 100% Chardonnay. Lemon meringue, honeysuckle and a touch of flinty minerality with peach cobbler and candied orange peels with a hint of hazelnut with bright acidity and stony minerality on the long, expressive finish. A wine like this one reminds me of how great Chardonnay can be, as it is perfectly balanced with delicious fruit, complex notes and lots of freshness and energy.
.
The Pinot Noir which mainly comes from Migration's estate vineyard in Russian River but it also includes vineyards from the coolest part of Russian River such as Green Valley and Sebastopol Hills.
.
2021 Migration, Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir, California: 100% Pinot Noir. A tantalizing nose with vivid notes of cherry chutney with ginger slices and allspice, ripe blueberries and crushed rocks along the silky tannins with a finish that was all finesse. If anyone tells you there are only lush, decadent Pinot Noir wines in California (love those wines too when I'm in the mood) then give them this wine as it is elegant, subtle yet multifaceted and mysterious.
.
#damewine
.
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #CaliforniaWine #Sonoma #russianrivervalley #PinotNoir #Chardonnay #finewine #youcandrinkwithus

The family-owned @edouard_delaunay_wines Edouard Delaunay was founded in Burgundy in 1893 but young Laurent Delaunay had to sell their winery, name and vineyards in the early 1990s because his father had Alzheimer's and the family business was on the brink of bankruptcy. Today, after running a successful wine business in Southern France, he has been able to buy back his family's winery and name and he is discovering the potential of vineyards in the Hautes-Côtes de Nuits, the birthplace of his family, as there are Jurassic limestone soils and high altitudes that made fruit that was too underripe in the past yet makes balanced and elegant wines with just the right amount of ripeness today because of climate change.
.
First 2 wines below are from his estate vineyards in th Hautes-Côtes de Nuits and then the next 2 wines are 1er Crus from growers who believe that even though he just relaunched his family's wines a few years ago that it is his birthright to use the top vineyards in Burgundy. And the last is an Aligoté from the vineyard that was planted by his enology Professor, which that time at university was so special to him as he was filled with hope and dreams of continuing the legacy of his family... just a few years later, tragedy would hit.
.
2021 "Charmont" Hautes-Côtes de Nuit: 100% Chardonnay. Intriguing wine with notes of star fruit and stony minerality on the nose and mouth watering flavors of green apple with a long finish leaving honeysuckle in my head.
.
2020 Les Rouards, Hautes-Côtes de Nuit: 100% Pinot Noir from a vineyard that is over 1,200 feet in altitude, less than 2.2 miles from Grand Crus and in Jurassic period limestone soil. Beautiful nose with enchanting lily of the valley aromas enhanced by freshly picked raspberries and a subtle hint of cinnamon with intense chalky minerality that has crunchy cranberry fruit on the palate and bright acidity and very fine tannins.
.
2020 Les Saints-Georges 1er Cru, Nuits-Saint-Georges: 100% Pinot Noir. Dark, brooding fruit with complex layers of forest floor and wild mushroom that becomes juicy on the palate with cassis flavors that are given structure by big, broad tannins that have a silky quality.
🔽

The Brunello di Montalcino estate @coldorcia is doing some fantastic things in the vineyards. To learn more go to my profile and click on link to read, "Tuscany Wine Producer Uses NASA Know-How To Combat Climate Change In The Vineyards"
.
2017 Col d’Orcia, Brunello di Montalcino DOCG: 100% Sangiovese. The nose gives juicy, rich fruit such as cassis and black cherry preserves with notes of broken rocks and round tannins on the palate with hints of nutmeg and pressed flowers.
.
2016 Col d’Orcia, Brunello di Montalcino DOCG, Vigna Nastagio: 100% Sangiovese from a single vineyard cru. Deep, dark fruits on the nose with flavors of blackberry scones with an intense minerality; elegant on the palate with chiseled tannins that give structure to the pristine fruit with hints of spice and overall harmony and a very long finish.
.
2015 Col d’Orcia, Brunello di Montalcino Riserva DOCG, Poggio al Vento: 100% Sangiovese from a single vineyard cru. The Poggio al Vento single vineyard is mainly sandy soil as opposed to clay which is dominant in the rest of the Col d’Orcia vineyards. Smoldering earth, cured meats, nutmeg with a slightly firm structure, black cherries and sandalwood incense with hints of tobacco leaf with a long, linear finish.
.
#damewine
.

New article up on Forbes about the iconic wine producer @TemposVegaSicilia in Ribera del Duero, Spain, and I have the tasting notes below but if you are interested in reading this piece just go to my profile, click on link and read "Winery Pays Top Dollar To Harvest Grapes, Making One Of The Greatest Wines In The World".
.
2013 Vega Sicilia, Unico, Ribera del Duero, Spain: 97% Tempranillo (Tinto Fino) and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon. Unico is aged for at least ten years before it is released onto the market. 2013 was a challenging vintage as it was cooler with more rain than usual. Immediately fresh and vibrant with an intense energy and drive on the palate with silky tannins with flavors of blackcurrants, wild sage, broken rocks and a fierce minerality on the long, expressive finish. The purity of its expression is quite impressive considering it was a rainy year.
.
NV Vega Sicilia, Unico Reserva Especial 2023 Release, Ribera del Duero, Spain: A blend of the 2009, 2011 and 2012 Unico vintages. Much more of an ethereal quality to this release. Lifted floral notes with bright red cherries and a richer background of blackberry compote yet it prances and dances along the palate, giving a lightness of being among the richness and multi-layered complexity that includes chalky minerality, spice box and sweet tobacco - a very long, polished finish. Extremely elegant! 
.
2018 Vega Sicilia, Valbuena 5º, Ribera del Duero, Spain: 96% Tempranillo (Tinto Fino) and 4% Merlot. The 5 in the name of the wine represents the fact that this wine is always aged five years in the cellar before being released onto the market. The wine from the Vega Sicilia estate that doesn’t reach the level of Unico icon status is used to make Valbuena 5º, which has become a star in its own right. Another cooler vintage but there is an immediate approachability to this wine that is very inviting with rose oil notes and blueberry pie flavors that has hints of cardamom pods and finely etched tannins on the palate that has lots of acidity with a soft quality so the wine has finesse as well as early drinking appeal.
.
#damewine

Calera @CaleraWine, founded in 1975 (my birth year) by well-respected vintner Josh Jensen, brought California Pinot Noir and Chardonnay to new heights with his stellar clones of the varieties, used by many top wineries today, and with a high-quality estate located up on the slopes on Mt. Harlan (limestone soils) in the Gabilan Mountains in the Central Coast; still today, the Mt. Harlan AVA fruit only goes to one winery - Calera.
.
2021 Central Coast Pinot Noir: 100% Pinot Noir from various top sites in the Central Coast. Crushed rocks, black cherries and warm raspberries with brambly fruit on the palate with shaved nutmeg and a soft texture with fresh acidity.
.
2019 Mt Harlan Pinot Noir from Ryan Vineyard: 100% Pinot Noir from a plot at an elevation of 2,500 feet. Pretty nose with pristine red cherries accented with cocoa nibs with a hint of red chili flakes with finely textured tannins along the expressively lifted finish.
.
2019 Mt. Harlan Pinot Noir from Mills Vineyard: 100% Pinot Noir from ungrafted vines at an elevation of 2,200 feet, planted in 1984. A mystical wine taking you to another land of a hidden magical forest with wild berries, jasmine flowers, rocky soils and a cool breeze that sends a shiver down one's spine. Yes, this wine inspires such imagery and so much more!
.
2021 Central Coast Chardonnay: 100% Chardonnay from a blend of Central Coast vineyards that mainly come from the Edna Valley. Honeysuckle, lime zest and wet stones make for a deliciously enticing nose with juicy mango flavors that has hints of fresh arugula notes.
.
2020 Mt Harlan Chardonnay: 100% Chardonnay from the two small Chardonnay plots on Mt Harlan at 2,200 elevation. One plot planted in 1984 and the other in 1998, and so, it is a multifaceted wine. Roasted almonds with apple tart and spicy notes on the nose with a rich body that has an electric energy with hints of a smoky minerality along the very long finish.
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #CaliforniaWine #PinotNoir #Chardonnay #finewine

Costières de Nîmes @costieres2nimes is a lovely little wine region in France as it is the most southern appellation in the Rhône yet the coolest due to its close proximity to the coast.
.
2021 Château Mourgues du Gres @MourguesduGres 'Fleur d'Eglantine' Rosé, Costières de Nîmes, France: Blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Wild strawberries and mouth watering rhubarb with citrus blossom and wet stones that is round and refreshing on the finish. 
.
2020 Domaine Gassier @DomaineGassier, Viognier, Costières de Nîmes, France: 100% Viognier. An enchanting perfumed nose of ripe apricots and white peach fruit with a hint of floral notes that has bright acidity that ideally balanced the delectably lush palate.
.
2019 Mas Carlot @MasCarlot 'Les Enfants Terribles' Costières de Nîmes, France: 60% Mourvèdre and 40% Syrah from old vines. A funny name considering it is inspired by the winemaker's children 🤣. An intriguing complex nose of wild morels, brambly berries and rosemary with pristine ripe black cherry on the finish that is lifted by spicy notes. 
.
#damewine
.

Rombauer @rombauervineyards has finally come out with a Pinot Noir! And I have to say it blew me away, which is not always such a popular thing to say for such a well-known brand, but I have to give it to them as they really delivered the goods!!! This famous family-owned winery is led by their great head winemaker, Richie Allen, and Richie worked on this project with Adam Lee, founder of Siduri - and so he is basically the Pinot Noir whisperer of the West Coast. They found their ideal vineyards in Santa Lucia Highlands. To learn more go to my latest Forbes article by clicking the link in my profile. 
. 
2021 Rombauer Pinot Noir, Santa Lucia Highlands (SLH): 100% Pinot Noir taken from some of the best vineyards in SLH; Garys’, Sierra Mar, Lemoravo, Rosella’s and Soberanes. A beautiful nose with hints of violets, cinnamon stick and cherry aromas that draws one in with richer boysenberry flavors and complex layers of smoky black tea and sweet tobacco that is laced with an intense minerality along with supple tannins. The finish is out of this world – juicy fruit and mouthwatering acidity that goes on and on. Really showcases the high pedigree of these stellar vineyards!
.
#damewine
.
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #CaliforniaWine #PinotNoir #SLHwine #SantaLuciaHighlands #finewine

The oldest Champagne house Maison Ruinart @Ruinart has opened up a pop-up space here in Manhattan, New York City, near the famous High Line @highlinenyc to showcase Ruinart’s commitment to art and sustainability and how both can form a symbiotic relationship.
.
As Ruinart has had a mission over recent years of finding innovative ways to promote biodiversity, such as planting 25,000 trees and shrubs within their vineyards and even commissioning land art pioneer Nils-Udo to build three tall birds’ nests to bring many feathered creatures to come to the Ruinart Taissy vineyard. And considering how creative Ruinart has been with encouraging biodiversity, it makes sense that they would partner up with the High Line as it is also an entity that has pushed boundaries in regards to how global cities can create more biodiversity by saving a historic, elevated freight rail line from being demolished by turning it into a public park with various species of plants.
.
Also, they are coming out with their first Champagne cuvée in 20 years called Blanc Singulier. This cuvée will be made in the warmest vintages from 100% Chardonnay.
.
The first edition will be released in selected restaurants in June as is called Blanc Singulier ‘Edition 18’ as it is made from 80% of the 2018 vintage and the rest is made from older reserve wines that all come from warmer vintages with a 0 g/l dosage, making it a Brut Nature Champagne with no sugar added during dosage. Brut Nature Champagnes have become very trendy in some circles and many Brut Nature Champagnes have come onto the market, with some being great examples and others being off-balanced as they lack the ripeness to balance the extreme acidity on their own, and so, some needed that small amount of sugar to help create a balanced wine; there is a reason why most Champagnes need a little bit of sugar. . 
.
Visit Maison 1729: From the Vineyards of Champagne to the High Line pop-up space:
.
Location:
500 W. 22nd Street, New York, NY 10011
.
Opening hours: 
May 26th & June 2nd, 9th: 11am – 5pm
.
May 25th & June 8th: 5pm – 9pm 
.
#damewine
#Ruinart
#MaisonRuinart

@NaiduWines is the story of an incredible woman from Punjab, India, who has an incredible journey across 4 continents to eventually end up buying a vineyard in the Sonoma Coast and having her first vintage a couple years ago make the wine list of a 3-Star Michelin restaurant. Her wines are truly fantastic! Go to my profile and click on link to read New Forbes article.
.
2021 Naidu, Pinot Noir, Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California: 100% Pinot Noir showcasing two vineyards: Naidu Estate and Marshall Ranch Vineyard with both having sandy loam soil of Goldridge and they are both sustainably farmed. This vintage is made up of the Dijon clone as well as clones 23, 115 and 777. An extremely elegant and harmonious Pinot Noir with juicy black cherry flavors enhanced by notes of violets and crushed rocks that has a silky texture with hints of plum tart and cardamom pods and a touch of grated nutmeg that finishes with a pristine red cherry flavor.
.
2021 Naidu, Rosé of Pinot Noir, Sonoma Coast, California: 75% of the Pinot Noir comes from Naidu Estate Vineyard and the rest of the Pinot Noir comes from the Marshall Ranch Vineyard, less than a mile away. Pretty nose with jasmine oil and cherry blossoms with a stony minerality and juicy red cherry and zingy cranberry flavors with a vibrant floral finish.
.
2021 Naidu, Grenache Blanc, Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California: 100% Grenache Blanc from Catie’s Corner Vineyard. Delicious nose with honeysuckle and white peach aromas that has tropical notes on the palate of green mango fleshed out with ripe Bosc pear flavors on the full body with a zingy lemon zest note lifting the finish.
.
NV Naidu, Brut Sparkling Wine, North Coast, California: Blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier. Nose of toast with citrus flowers and white strawberries with lemon meringue flavors that has fine bubbles that caress the palate with crisp acidity.
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #CaliforniaWine #PinotNoir #SonomaWine #RussianRiverValley #GrenacheBlanc #finewine

These single vineyard Pinot Noir wines from @CaleraWine are stunning! 
.
2020 Calera, Mt. Harlan, Pinot Noir, de Villiers Vineyard: Lush dark fruit such as black cherry and blackcurrant with an underlining intense minerality with hints of forest floor on the nose with a beautiful purity of red cherry fruit on the palate and mouthwatering acidity.
.
2020 Calera, Mt. Harlan, Pinot Noir, Reed Vineyard: Charming wine with delicious red cherry pie with hints of fresh sage with more structure and silky tannins finishing with strawberry compote.
.
2020 Calera, Mt. Harlan, Pinot Noir, Jensen Vineyard: Lovely notes of cocoa dust, candied violets and fresh rhubarb with a palate that is as close to perfect as one can get with Pinot Noir as it is juicy with just the right amount of mid-palate weight and extremely fine texture with multi-layers of an array of red fruit finishing with a long, expressive mineral note.
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #CaliforniaWine #PinotNoir #finewine #youcansipwithus

Such a pleasure to talk to the chief winemaker Trevor Durling at BV @bvwines to learn more in-depth about its history, I knew some things but there are other unknown tidbits that were truly fascinating. Also, celebrating the 2016 vintage of Rarity, only the 6th vintage to be released. To learn more go to my profile and click on the link to read the new Forbes article "A Napa Valley Wine Founder Releases $1,250 Rare Flagship Wine Of Exceptional Quality"
.
2016 Beaulieu Vineyard (BV) ‘Rarity’ Rutherford, Napa Valley (magnum format): 95% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot. 2016 was an excellent vintage for Napa, and Trevor says it is the “best one” he has seen in his career. The wine certainly leaves one speechless as it is something unique and rare. Multilayered nose with rich cocoa dust and uplifting violet notes with a lovely texture on the body that is reminiscent of delicate lace that is enhanced by delicious flavors of blueberry tart with a backbone of intense minerality and freshness on the long, expressive finish. Only 188 cases made. Price $1,250.
.
2013 Beaulieu Vineyard (BV) ‘Rarity’ Rutherford, Napa Valley (magnum format): 90% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Petit Verdot. 2013 is one of the “most powerful vintages” that Trevor has experienced and its bigger structure makes it seem more youthful than 2016. Fresh tobacco, graphite and dried sage create an enticing nose that draws one into the deep flavors of blackcurrant cordial with complex hints of tar and autumn leaves with broad tannic shoulders that are round and approachable yet suggest this will make great old bones. Only 125 cases made. Price $1,600.
.
More tasting notes in comments⬇️
#damewine
.

A rosé wine made from Carignan sourced from 115-year-old vines in Mendocino County, California, for only $27. Wow, wow, wow!!!
.
2022 Minus Tide @minustidewines Feliz Creek Vineyard, Carignan Rosé, Mendocino, California: 100% Carignan from 115-year-old vines from a vineyard that is dry-farmed, organically managed and family-owned. A stunning salmon pinkish color with aromas of strawberry sorbet, wet stones and citrus blossom that completely delights with raspberry coulis flavors on the palate with hints of seashells and a salined-laced, dry finish with fresh acidity. Just a fantastic wine that will up your rosé game for not that much money! Only 153 cases were produced.
.
Minus Tide was started by three people who have other day jobs, two are winemakers at other companies, and two are a wife and husband team, and so, it is really a passion project during their downtime. They are all about bringing a spotlight to family-owned vineyards that are truly hidden gems that are managed with love and care, and this Feliz Creek Vineyard is a great example of what they are all about.
.
#damewine
.
#CaliforniaWine #Mendocino #thinkpink #rosé #rose #finewine #Carignan #wine #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #sommelier #vino #finewines #instagram #vin #amazing #beautiful #thinkpink #pink #delicious #happy #youcansipwithus

When I first read the award-winning Red Wine book by co-authors Mike DeSimone & Jeff Jenssen back in November of 2017, wow time flies, I immediately thought, 'Now, this is the way someone should set up a wine book that is actually for people who love to drink wine.' And now, they have released its much anticipated companion book: White Wine: The Comprehensive Guide to the 50 Essential Varieties & Styles.
.
The book is organized in a way that many Americans think about wine - grape variety, and then, it will break down information into boxes that helps someone who just needs to see a quick tasting profile, food pairing ideas and bottle recommendations when they need a quick wine idea in a hurry, to expanding beyond those boxes into more in-depth information with history and typical wine regions for each grape and some winemaker wisdom.
.
It can be either a wonderful learning tool for beginners or a valuable reference book for those with more knowledge and experience.
.
Mike DeSimone & Jeff Jenssen @WorldWineGuys are wine columnists for Robb Report, Wine Enthusiast and Forbes as well as being featured experts on Today, CBS, CNN, Hallmark, NBC, WGN and many more. Their passion for wine just beams from them both and that passion is evident in their latest book.
.
#damewine
.
#wine #whitewine #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #vino #instagram #vin #amazing #beautiful #delicious #happy #youcansipwithus

Always loved @SusanaBalboWines but it was incredible to learn more about her story for Forbes "1st Female Winemaker In Argentina Survived Major Scam To Build Successful Winery"
.
2020 Susana Balbo ‘Signature’ White Blend from La Delfina Estate in Paraje Altamira, Uco Valley, Mendoza, Argentina: 42% Sémillon, 33% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Torrontés from an elevation of around 3,770 on the La Delfina Estate. Multi-layered aromatics include honeysuckle, fresh herbs, orange peel with blanched almonds and subtle spice notes on the palate with white peach flavors and a long, flavorful finish.
.
2022 Susana Balbo ‘Crios’ Torrontés, Argentina: 100% Torrontés grapes are sourced from Uco Valley in Mendoza and Cafayate in Salta in vineyards that average around 5,500 feet in altitude. The Crios line of wines focuses on the beautiful expression of the grape varieties grown in ideal areas of Argentina. Also, the Crios wines support local communities with various charity events. A delicious example of Torrontés with a floral nose and juicy mango and pineapple flavors on the palate with bright acidity and a round, fruit-driven finish.
.
2022 Susana Balbo ‘Signature’ Barrel Fermented Torrontés, Paraje Altamira, Uco Valley, Mendoza, Argentina: 100% Torrontés grapes located at an average of 3,770 feet altitude in the famed wine area of Paraje Altamira. The ‘Signature’ line is focused on mastering classic varieties and taking on some of Susana’s most revolutionary projects of pushing the boundaries of winemaking. Enticing aromas of citrus blossom and a stony minerality with lychee flavors intermixed with delicate notes of flowers – perfectly balanced; a good amount of weight on the textured body that has a lovely silky quality across the long, expressive finish.
.
More tasting notes in comments⬇️
.
