Always so exciting to taste one of my favorite wine producers: Merry Edwards @merryedwardswinery
.
2021 Merry Edwards, Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir, Santa Rosa Plains, Russian River Valley: Stunning nose with lilac, orange peel and rosebud that is just as gorgeous on the palate with fresh rhubarb, crushed rocks and cherry blossoms; an incredible feat of being juicy yet ethereal - a real beauty!
.
2021 Merry Edwards, Coopersmith Vineyard Pinot Noir, Laguna Ridge, Russian River Valley: Dark and brooding with cocoa dust and blackcurrants balanced by a refreshing earthy quality like the rainforest after a storm. Lots of plush blue and black fruit on the palate that is highlighted by cinnamon stick and grated nutmeg. Delicious!
.
2021 Merry Edwards, Georganne Vineyard Pinot Noir, Middle Reach, Russian River Valley: Multilayered nose that takes more time to express itself, so it's worth decanting. Intense mineral backbone with savory notes of tobacco leaf and dried herbs intermixed with sweet flavors of boysenberry pie and has a bigger structure than the previous wines giving it a powerful finish.
.
2021 Merry Edwards, Pinot Noir, Russian River Valley: Always a well-balanced, harmonious wine that sources from many Russian River Valley vineyards and this one certainly doesn't disappoint with juicy black cherries and black tea leaves with a background of wet stones, all woven together by round, finely etched tannins creating the right amount of structure.
.
2021 Merry Edwards, Dach Vineyard Pinot Noir, Anderson Valley, Mendocino County: Bright red cherries, jasmine oil and aniseed with mouthwatering acidity, crunchy cranberries and delicate texture with a saline finish.
.
2021 Merry Edwards, Sauvignon Blanc, Russian River Valley: Exotically enticing aromas of kaffir lime and green mango with a steely minerality that is devastatingly delicious on the palate with lime coulis drizzled over pineapple upside-down cake. Merry Edwards may be known for their Pinot Noir wines, but their Sauvignon Blanc is also a killer!
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #sommelier #vino #instagram #vin #amazing

I love me some Turnbull wines @turnbullwines from Napa Valley, and I was so thrilled to see the northern Italian grape Lagrein make up 4% of their Reserve!
.
2020 Turnbull, Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa Valley: 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 2% Malbec. Smoldering incense wafting in my head with dark chocolate and a stony minerality with elegant plum and blueberry fruit that is all finesse with bright acidity and a long finish that leaves one with lifted expressive pure fruit flavors.
.
2020 Turnbull, Cabernet Sauvignon, Oakville Reserve, Napa Valley: 96% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Lagrein. Extremely complex nose of graphite, gravelly earth and black cherry cobbler with a deep concentration of dark fruit on the palate with an incredible silky texture and a finish that goes on and on, leaving one with the heavenly flavor of black raspberry liqueur.
.
#damewine
.
#CaliforniaWine #NapaValley #finewine #CabernetSauvignon #wine #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #sommelier #vino #instagram #vin #amazing #beautiful #delicious #happy #Oakville #youcansipwithus @napavintners @oakvillewinegrower

I just discovered this fun Champagne producer called Château de Bligny @blignychampagne - the only Champagne house that is a château and they have the only registered Clos, walled vineyard, that has six out of the seven allowed grape varieties. I just did a Forbes story about their partnership with Theo Fabergé, where they created a "Champagne Egg" for a special limited edition packaging, and only a few exist in the US for $5,400 but this is only for this special edition as typically their Champagnes are a great value. 
.
They have their regular Champagnes on the market that range from $30-$50 and I would recommend grabbing a bottle. They are most known for their Blanc de Blancs.
.
2013 Château de Bligny 'Clos de Chateau' 6 Cépages Millésime Brut Nature Champagne (Theo Fabergé Edition): Blend of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Pinot Meunier, Arbane, Petit Meslier and Pinot Blanc. This is the first vintage Champagne made by Château de Bligny, and the 2013 vintage is a great one. Lemon blossom with broken limestone and candied lilacs on the nose with creamy lemon curd on the palate with fine bubbles that caress and a very long, expressive finish. $5,400
.
#damewine
.
@champagne_officiel #Champagne #France #bubbles #sparkling #wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #PinotNoir #finewine #youcandrinkwithus #sparklingwine #sparklingwines

So much fun to learn about the story behind Emeritus Vineyards @emerituswines making a still white wine out of Pinot Noir and to meet family owner Mari Jones, who is taking over for her father, Brice Cutrer Jones - a true titan of the California wine industry.
.
2021 Emeritus Vineyards, Hallberg Blanc, Russian River Valley, Estate Grown Pinot Noir Blanc: The white Pinot Noir a.k.a. Pinot Noir Blanc is made by only using the free run juice, which is the juice that flows freely from freshly picked grapes before they are pressed, and the grapes are picked at night so that they come into the winery very cool, keeping their aromatic complexity and not picking up anything significant from the skins and seeds; the skins of the Pinot Noir grapes are what gives it its color. Citrus blossom and lemon tart with hints of saline minerality with bright acidity balanced by good weight on the mid-palate and juicy white peach flavors with white flowers on the finish.
.
2020 Emeritus Vineyards, Pinot Hill, Sonoma Coast, Estate Grown Pinot Noir: Intriguing nose with broken rocks and crushed rose petals with zingy rhubarb that expands into more decadent flavors of dried red raspberries with round tannins and a mineral finish reminiscent of broken seashells. 
.
2020 Emeritus Vineyards, Hallberg Ranch, Russian River Valley, Estate Grown Pinot Noir: A wine that seduces from the first sip with lots of lush fruit such as strawberry candies balanced by fresh basil leaf that finishes with breathtaking pristine fruit – an elegant beauty.
.
2019 Emeritus Vineyards, Wesley’s Reserve, Hallberg Ranch, Russian River Valley, Estate Grown Pinot Noir: Year in and year out, the center blocks of Hallberg Ranch give the most powerful wines and so those blocks are sourced for Wesley’s Reserve, named after Brice’s father. Big, broad shoulders on this wine with sculpted tannins that are enhanced by rich, juicy fruit and hints of wild thyme that has an incredible overall vitality.
.
Another tasting note in comments ⬇️
.
#damewine

One of the great Rioja wine producers!
La Rioja Alta, S.A. @lariojaaltasa
.
2016 La Rioja Alta, S.A., Viña Ardanza Reserva, Rioja, Spain: 80% Tempranillo and 20% Garnacha. Guillermo calls this wine “the archetype of Rioja” as it blends Tempranillo from the sub-zone Rioja Alta and Garnacha from the sub-zone Rioja Alavesa, each from their classic home. Tons of freshness and vibrancy to this wine with ripe red raspberries and orange peel with a subtle underlying note of smoldering earth and dried bay leaves with a long, flavorful finish with hints of nutmeg and purity of fruit that is just stunning at the end. .
.
2005 La Rioja Alta, S.A., Gran Reserva 890, Rioja, Spain: 95% Tempranillo, 3% Graciano and 2% Mazuelo. A very concentrated wine with succulent flavors of cassis and blackberry liqueur that has enticing hints of baking spice and toasted coconut, displaying the incredible heart of the marriage between American oak and Rioja wine with a silky texture and multilayered finish with new leather, truffles and still plenty of fruit to balance the complex notes perfectly. Fantastic!
.
#damewine
.
#wine #winelover #winetime #winery #winerylovers #winetasting #winelovers #winetravel #cheers #Spain #Tempranillo #Rioja #redwine #finewine #youcandrinkwithus

Tasting a vertical that went back to 1970 really showed how Bodegas Montecillo @bodegasmontecillo wines can age! Also, this tasting event took place at José Andrés rooftop cocktail bar Nubeluz @nubeluzbyjose in Manhattan, NYC, and it is a jaw dropping stunning place!!!
.
1970 Bodegas Montecillo, Gran Reserva Selección Especial: 80% Tempranillo, 15% Mazuelo and 5% Graciano. Garnet color with a light rim that had layers of complexity with new leather, grated nutmeg, cigar and tar with a silky texture and rich blackberry flavors with tobacco leaf and coconut shavings with a bright acidity. 
.
1973 Bodegas Montecillo, Gran Reserva Selección Especial: 70% Tempranillo, 15% Garnacha and 15% Mazuelo. Brick color with dusty earth on the nose, hints of grilled bacon, and juicy black cherry fruit on the palate with soft tannins balanced by crisp acidity. 
.
1982 Bodegas Montecillo, Gran Reserva Selección Especial: 100% Tempranillo. It was one of the most important vintages for Rioja, even though there were some exceptions for conscientious producers but much of the 1970s was considered mediocre, so it was the first great vintage since 1964. A spicy nose with aniseed and coriander with sandalwood in the background, very fine tannins, and a touch of zingy sour cherries on the palate balanced by strawberry preserves and a long, savory, spicy finish. 
.
1985 Bodegas Montecillo, Gran Reserva Selección Especial: 90% Tempranillo and 10% Graciano. A pale color with an intense smoky minerality on the nose and bright cranberry flavors on the palate layered with baking spices and underbrush, a nimble wine with lots of verve. 
.
1994 Bodegas Montecillo, Gran Reserva Selección Especial: 100% Tempranillo. One of the most recognized vintages worldwide as it is considered when modern Rioja started. Smoldering earth, cloves and wildflowers are enchanting on the nose, with lush red fruit on the palate, such as cherry pie and strawberry compote with plush tannins balanced by fresh acidity with a long, flavorful finish. 
.

2021 Morét-Brealynn, Russian River Valley, California: 100% Pinot Noir. Deliciously delightful with plum tart, fresh blueberries and hints of jasmine with lots of energy and drive on the palate with tarragon and cherry compote.

2021 Morét-Brealynn ‘Stray Cats’ Sonoma County, California: 100% Muscadelle. Salty minerality and lemon zest with juicy peach flavors and citrus blossom.

2021 Morét-Brealynn ‘Stray Dogs’ Central Coast, California: 100% Pinot Noir. Broken earth, black cherries and warming baking spices on the nose with dried herbs and fine tannins on the palate with a floral finish.

It was thrilling to attend a vertical of Bella Oaks Vineyard @bellaoaksvineyard almost going back 50 years, one of the first single vineyards of Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa and only a few years after Martha's Vineyard - both were made by the Heitz family for a time, and to taste the new outstanding vintages under the new ownership of Suzanne Deal Booth who is finally giving Bella Oaks its own voice was truly a gift. To read more go to my profile and click on link to read new Forbes article. And a few of the tasting notes are below with the rest in the comments. .

2021 Bella Oaks Proprietary Red Wine: 96% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Petit Verdot and 1% Cabernet Franc. Winemaker Nigel Kinsman. This is a preview as the wine will not be released until Fall 2024. Deep ruby color with hints of purple that is juicy from the first sip with kirsch flavors and touches of blueberry scone that was concentrated yet feminine in its overall finesse of the delivery of the intensity of fruit married with the lace-like structure.
.
2019 Bella Oaks Proprietary Red Wine: 93% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Cabernet Franc. Winemaker Nigel Kinsman. This vintage is currently on the market. A wine that brings tears of joy; it is so good with pressed rose petals, orange peel and a dusting of cocoa powder on the intoxicating nose with a stunning purity of red and black fruit on the palate and complex notes of cigar box lingering for a long time in one’s head. Extremely impressive!
.
2018 Bella Oaks Proprietary Red Wine: 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Petit Verdot and 8% Cabernet Franc. Winemaker Nigel Kinsman. Shocking how this could be Nigel’s and Suzanne’s debut wine as it is a knock-out with a compelling perfumed nose that has many layers that go beyond floral qualities as there is pepper, cardamom pods and fresh tarragon with lots of crushed rocks in the background that has a broad body with a silky texture that immediately seduces.
.

.

I love the idea behind the label of this wine, as the "Postmark" is an official seal traditionally stamped on letters to indicate a place and date, and so, sharing a bottle of wine would ideally create the same experience, transporting one to a particular place in time.
.

2021 Postmark, Cabernet Sauvignon, Paso Robles, California: 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Petite Sirah and 5% Merlot. The nose has notes of broken rocks, blueberry tart and spicy blackberry chutney with lots of brightness and acidity on the palate with deliciously juicy fruit and hints of thyme that is simply scrumptious.
.

The Chappellet family @chappellet_winery are not only the pioneers and evangelists of the extraordinary Pritchard Hill hillside vineyards in Napa Valley, but they also go back a long way with other multigenerational winegrowers in different areas and promote their incredible fruit by placing them in their Grower Collection lineup.
.
2021 Chappellet, Grower Collection Chardonnay, Sangiacomo Vineyard, Carneros, California: The Sangiacomo family has been farming since 1927, and their cool-climate, windswept vineyard in Sonoma's Carneros region allows grapes to slowly mature, developing complexity and intensity while retaining freshness. This 2021 Chardonnay has delicious aromas of honeysuckle and citrus blossom, juicy white peach on the palate, and just the right amount of creamy texture with bright acidity on the mouthwatering finish.
.
2021 Chappellet, Grower Collection Pinot Noir, Dutton Ranch. Russian River Valley, California: In 1967, Warren Dutton helped to establish the Russian River by planting his first vineyard, and today, his sons, Steve and Joe, carry on their father's legacy. This wine is sourced from the Dutton Ranch sections tucked away in the cool, foggy hills above the Russian River Valley, resulting in a wine with depth and concentration. This 2021 Pinot Noir has dark, sensual fruit on the nose, such as black raspberry and mulberry aromas, with warming spices such as cinnamon and cloves; the multilayered complexity really comes out on the palate with espresso and crushed rocks with a hint of fresh sage with a good amount of structure giving a lift to the richness and a lovely round texture on the finish.
.

The word "unique" can often get used too much in the wine world, but anyone who knows of the Greek island of Santorini knows that the vineyards are truly unique. Santorini is a volcanic desert with low rainfall and strong winds. The vines are spaced widely apart from each other and trained in a spiral, basket-like shape to protect them from the hot, dry winds while keeping them from evaporating water, as the vines typically receive no water during the growing season. And so, these low-yielding vines will produce wines that are concentrated with a strong sense of place while retaining freshness and acidity. Many of the vines are old, ungrafted vines, such as the Assyrtiko dry white wines below, and the last wine comes from vines that are up to 200 years old.
.
2019 Estate Argyros @estate_argyros, Cuvee Evdemon: 100% Assyrtiko from 150-200-year-old ungrafted vines farmed biodynamically. A much more concentrated Assyrtiko with layers of stone fruit and rich lemon meringue flavors with an intriguing smoky minerality that is beautifully balanced because although the 2019 vintage is a richer one for Argyros, they still have that overall elegance and finesse with lots of freshness which they are known for.
.
2022 Santo Wines @santo_wines: 100% Assyrtiko from vines that are 60 to 80 years old. Stony minerality and seashell on the nose with white peach flavors and mouth-watering acidity on the palate.
.
2022 Domaine Sigalas @domainesigalas: 100% Assyrtiko from vines over 60 years old. Intense minerality and white flower aromas with lemon peel and juicy nectarine with hints of honeysuckle on the finish.
.
2021 GAI'A Thalassitis @GAIAwines : 100% Assyrtiko from 70-80 year-old ungrafted vines. More tropical fruit with green mango and lemon curd notes on the palate and crisp acidity with saline minerality on the finish.
.
#damewine
.

Such a pleasure to interview the CEO and 7th-generation family member of the Champagne Billecart-Salmon house @champagne_billecart_salmon, Mathieu Roland-Billecart @mrbillecart. To learn more go to my profile and click on link to read Forbes article about new developments at Billecart-Salmon. Below are the Champagnes that we tasted.
.
2008 Billecart-Salmon Cuvée Nicolas François (My Origin # 081078): 83% of wines came from stainless steel and 17% came from barrel, 83% Grand Cru vineyards and 17% Premier Cru vineyards, 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay, with a dosage of 2.9 grams per liter. 2008 was considered a superstar year with a fantastic combination of beautiful fruit and high acidity and one can see why in this 2008 Nicolas François, named after the founder of Champagne Billecart-Salmon. The nose beckons with delicately enticing notes of honeysuckle and lemon pastry with hints of lilacs in the background that has marked acidity and an intense energy on the palate that is simply breathtaking, with a chalky minerality on the long, expressive finish.
.
1998 Billecart-Salmon Cuvée Nicolas François: Mathieu wanted to show a Champagne with a lot more age to display the incredible longevity that Billecart is known for yet he also wanted to show a vintage known for its ripeness and how the fresh style of Billecart keeps such a vintage still vibrant even at 25 years of age. The fruit is still vivid with juicy nectarine with touches of marzipan and lemon meringue that are intermixed with orange zest and toasted spices on the palate, concentrated with fresh fruit yet bright acidity and a broad, rich finish with lots of lift.
.

I was so excited to try these two Brandlin Estate  @brandlin_wine beauties from Napa Valley as the Sauvignon Blanc is a blend of two vineyards and one of the vineyards is planted with a clone from the iconic d'Yquem estate - WOW! And the second wine is a Malbec from the Brandlin Estate property, located high on the steep rocky slopes of Mount Veeder in Napa, which gives the best of both worlds as it has the brightness and structure of a Malbec from Southwest France with the lush, juicy fruit of Argentinian Malbec. Fantastic!
.
2021 Brandlin Estate, Sauvignon Blanc, Napa Valley: A mixture of two vineyards: a warmer site with a Sauvignon Blanc d'Yquem Clone and the other from a cooler site planted with Sauvignon Musque Clone. Enchanting aromas of passionfruit, lemon blossom with stony minerality that has a delicious balance of zesty orange peel with rich quince paste along the palate which has shape and drive with bright acidity and a lengthy, spicy finish.
.
2019 Brandlin Estate, Malbec, Mount Veeder, Napa Valley: From a prized block on the Brandlin Estate Vineyard that is planted with ENTAV Malbec Clone 595. ENTAV is a French agency that guarantees the French origins of clones as well as the health and quality status. Pretty violet notes intermixed with smoldering incense making this wine an extoic beauty that is irresistible with juicy blackberry fruit and hints of blueberry scone and Lapsang Souchong tea that is incredibly silky, caressing the palate and the finish has lots of vitality with fresh, vivid fruit.
.

Second-generation president and CEO of Spottswoode @spottswoodewinery, Beth Novak Milliken, said that her mother Mary Novak, who was also the founder of Spottswoode, loved Sauvignon Blanc and it was her favorite wine. And this 2022 Spottswoode Sauvignon Blanc is certainly something special as it comes from vineyards in Napa and Sonoma that really express the beauty of this grape variety. Many of these family vineyards have been working with them for decades and Spottswoode has given major technical support as well as financial incentives to help these family vineyards with the transition to organic farming. Various vessels in the winery are used such as stainless steel, French oak, concrete, ceramic and clay amphora to help highlight the individual expression of each plot while bringing multi-layered complexity to the wine.
.
2022 Spottswoode Sauvignon Blanc: Citrus blossom, wet river stones and spiced sauteed peaches that is vibrant yet rich on the palate with juicy grapefruit flavors finishing with an incredible saline minerality along the textured body. This is a wonderful example of a great Napa/Sonoma Sauvignon Blanc!
.

So inspiring to learn how a noble family from Piedmont, Italy, moved to Chile to make wine and took what they learned there to have more of a grower mentality once they took over a historic estate in Montalcino, Tuscany @coldorcia Col d'Orcia. 
The latest in my article for Forbes:
"Italian Wine Producer Inspired By South America To Change Tuscan Estate From Commercial Mindset To Grower Mentality"
.
The wines are below and always wonderful to taste great Brunello di Montalcino wines as they show the real beauty of the Sangiovese grape. And there are some top vintages in this lineup!
.
1995: Multifaceted wine with tapenade, dried porcini mushrooms, cigar box and broken earth that is extremely soft in the mouth with an underlying note of dried rose petals and a lot of concentration of fruit on the finish, which is quite impressive at this age. 
.
2004 Riserva, Poggio al Vento Vineyard: Exciting developed notes such as tar, black truffles and crushed rose petals with silky tannins that have a touch of plush quality on the palate with still lots of juicy red and black fruit with a lovely overall texture.
.
2015 Riserva, Poggio al Vento Vineyard: Riper, juicer fruit with plush mid-palate and hints of baking spice with a round texture and overall generosity that is incredibly delicious.
.
 2016 Riserva, Poggio al Vento Vineyard: Intriguing sandalwood aroma with a deep concentration of multi-layered fruit nuanced in its delivery with finely etched tannins and lots of crisp acidity with a very long, expressive floral finish. A stunning wine.
.
2018 Nastagio Vineyard: This wine takes more time to open, but once it does, complex notes such as smoldering earth and Mediterranean herbs come out with dark, brooding fruit on the palate and ample tannins that are muscular and through time, notes such as underbrush, black licorice and wildflowers start to reveal themselves along a sustained, powerful length of flavor. 
.

Loving this lineup of beauties from Duckhorn Vineyards @duckhornwine in Napa Valley, California!
.
2019 Duckhorn Vineyards, 'The Discussion' Napa Valley Red Wine: 'The Discussion' represents the pinnacle of the Duckhorn Vineyards lineup with 67% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Merlot, 1% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc from 6 legendary vineyards in Napa. A super star right from the bottle with tantalizing aromas of espresso, chocolate covered cherries and cardamom pods with concentrated flavors of raspberry preserves intermixed with crushed rocks; rich, smoky and spicy - a very sultry wine that seduces from the first sip.
.
2020 Duckhorn Vineyards, Napa Valley Merlot, Three Palms Vineyard: 98% Merlot and 2% Malbec from the Three Palms Vineyard. The Merlot was so stunning in the 2020 vintage from this vineyard that it makes up 98% of the bottling for this year, and once you taste it you will know why! Multilayered nose of blueberry scone, sweet tobacco and cocoa nibs with finely etched tannins that give an elegant structure that has an intense minerality and layers on layers of fruit along the flavorful finish.
.
2020 Duckhorn Vineyards, Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon: 91% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc sourced from 5 estate sites in Rutherford, Oak Knoll, St. Helena and Calistoga. A very charming nose with aromas of violets and cinnamon toast with lots of delicious black and blue fruit on the palate with a moderately plush mid-palate and silky tannins that caress.
.
2022 Duckhorn Vineyards, North Coast Sauvignon Blanc: A delectable blend of Sauvignon Blanc fruit from Napa Valley and Sonoma County that has notes of lemon verbena tea with orange blossom that has lots of juicy passion fruit flavors on the palate finishing with a stony minerality and mouthwatering acidity.
.

You got to love bang for your buck wines especially when they are super premium sparklers!

@ScharffenbergerCellars has been pioneering super premium Mendocino sparkling wine since 1981. And if you know anything about the northern California area of Mendocino, it is a beautiful display of Mother Earth in all her glory with a cooler climate than its more famous winegrowing neighbors, and so, Pinot Noir and Chardonnay do extraordinarily well when growing them for the intention of making excellent sparkling wine. Two examples below, Brut Excellence and Brut Excellence Rosé are priced at $24 and $30 respectively.
.
Scharffenberger, Brut Excellence: 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Noir. Lemon meringue with hints of croissant and white flowers with a creamy texture and delectable marzipan flavors with fresh acidity.
.
Scharffenberger, Brut Excellence Rosé: 55% Chardonnay and 45% Pinot Noir. Pristine pale pink color with zingy red cranberries intermixed with raspberry strudel and an electric note of orange zest with fine, tiny bubbles that caress the palate.
.

2018 Lapostolle ‘la Parcelle 8’ Apalta, Colchagua Valley, Chile: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon. A wine that balances power and finesse beautifully with the deeply concentrated black fruit that is highlighted by a mixture of savory, tapenade, with enchanting notes, violets, that is at once decadently delicious with flavors of cocoa powder, and aristocratically pleasing with aromas of cigar box, all laced with an intense minerality and finely etched tannins. 
.
2022 Lapostolle ‘Cuvée Alexandre’ Cabernet Franc, Apalta, Colchagua Valley, Chile: This Cabernet Franc ‘Cuvée Alexandre’ bottling is a new release for Lapostolle and it should hit the market in December of this year. Andrea León said that they have been very happy with how well their Cabernet Franc has been showing throughout the years, and that it finally deserved its own bottling; such an elegant wine with pretty aromas of jasmine with hints of blackcurrant leaf that has a fine structure with juicy blueberry fruit on the palate. 
.
2021 Lapostolle ‘Cuvée Alexandre’ Cabernet Sauvignon, Apalta, Colchagua Valley, Chile: 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Cabernet Franc, 4% Merlot and 4% Petit Verdot. Multilayered dark fruit with cardamom and anise seed spices giving an aromatic lift to the fruit that has fresh sage herbs intermixed along the silky tannins that give enough structure for an overall elegant quality. 
.
2021 Lapostolle ‘Cuvée Alexandre’ Carménère, Apalta, Colchagua Valley, Chile: 85% Carmenère, 6% Cabernet Franc, 5% Syrah and 4% Grenache. Ripe, juicy plum fruit from the first sip with complex notes of green peppercorn and crush granite with nicely manicured tannins that caress the palate.
.
More tasting notes in comments⬇️

2021 Bouchaine Estate @bouchaine_vineyards  Pinot Noir, Carneros, Napa Valley: 100% Pinot Noir from the Bouchaine estate which is located on the southern border of Napa Valley's Carneros, overlooking the San Francisco Bay, and the consistent fog, wind and cold night temperatures retain the acidity and aromatic complexity of the grapes. Pretty purple flowers interlaced with blueberry tart and baking spices with juicy red plum notes and delicious flavors of blueberry tart that has an added complexity of broken rocks and refreshing acidity with tannins that have the quality of silky ribbons.

Calling all acid and salinity lovers!! If you haven't tried white wines from @bodegasgranbazan, Spanish wines from Rías Baixas, then you are missing out! 
.
2022 Bodegas Granbazán ‘Etiqueta Verde’: 100% Albariño. Notes of salted lemon with sea shell and lemon meringue on the palate with lots of energy and bright acidity.
.
2022 Bodegas Granbazán ‘Etiqueta Ambar’: 100% Albariño. Broken rocks with fresh acidity with zingy lemon peel notes and a broader body with juicy peach flavors and spicy notes.
.
2020 Bodegas Granbazán ‘D. Álvaro de Bazán’: 100% Albariño. Intriguing notes of orange blossom and pressed flowers with lemon sorbet flavors on the palate with marked acidity and a broad, flavorful finish with saline minerality.
.
2018 Bodegas Granbazán, D. Álvaro de Bazán: 100% Albariño. Multifaceted nose with dried chamomile, ripe golden apples and honeycomb aromas that has an intense minerality with layers of wet stone and sea spray that has a broad body with nectarine crumb tart on the palate and refreshing acidity on the long, flavorful finish. 
.
2020 Bodegas Granbazán ‘Limousin’: 100% Albariño. Delectable aromas of quince paste and honeysuckle with a hint of cumin seeds with mouthwatering acidity with a mixture of tropical and citrus fruits on the palate with a very long, expressive finish.
.
2019 Bodegas Granbazán, Veigalobos Vineyard: 100% Albariño; waxed top with a modern label as opposed to the traditional labels for Bodegas Granbazán as this is a new project started in 2018. From a walled single vineyard called Veigalobos with granite rock layers of calcareous alluvial elements in its soil, it produces a powerful expression of Albariño. It has some skin contact during fermentation, where 20% of the berries still have their skins intact but they are placed in a sort of tea bag material so they can be removed at any stage of the fermentation to avoid having the skin contact going too far. Honeycomb with crushed rocks and dried wildflowers with lots of salinity and sour lemon drops with a structured palate that makes this a very gastronomic wine.
.

Some tickets to heaven don't cost a fortune and this pairing is a perfect example!
.
Want to know what makes certain people go so crazy for French food and wine? And I'm not talking about the world of dropping a bunch of money, I mean that which is for all people.
.
Well, buy yourself some French Comté cheese from the humble French area of Massif du Jura and then pick up an extremely affordable bottle of a Côtes du Rhône Blanc - white wine blend from the Rhône Valley in France, and I recommend this small producer @domaine_pelaquie Domaine Pélaquié, whose family has been farming this land since the 16th century. Not so easy to find but worth the hunt at only $13 for magic in a bottle. The 2022 is a blend of 20% Viognier, 20% Grenache blanc, 20% Clairette, 15% Roussanne, 15% Marsanne and 10% Bourboulenc, and it is a seductive wine with a lush body and juicy peach flavors intermixed with floral and mineral notes that is balanced by a fresh acidity that goes so well with the supple texture of the Comté cheese that has smoky aromas that are complemented by notes of brown butter, hazelnut and nutmeg which all dance a slow tango with the aromas and flavors of the Côtes du Rhône Blanc wine.
.
Vive la France!
.

The wonderful family Cava sparkling wine producer, Juvé & Camps, has paid for translating the first and second volumes of wine books from master chef Ferran Adrià, of El Bulli fame, called Bullipedia Wine Sapiens from Spanish to English, so many of us can enjoy the incredible insights in these books.
.
And so I make a toast to them as being a wonderful example in their own right with their 2016 Gran Reserva! 
.
2016 Juvé & Camps, Gran Reserva Cava, Catalonia, Spain: Blend of Xarel·lo, Macabeo, Chardonnay and Parellada. Such a beautiful minerality from this Cava from the first sip with juicy white peach flavors enhanced by lemon peel brightness with a touch of complex aromas of spiced toast and almond cookies with an impressive overall balance of richness, acidity and delicate texture created by the finesse of the tiny bubbles caressing the palate.
.

Always a great pleasure to taste the wines of @piocesare1881
.
2019 Pio Cesare, Mosconi Vineyard: This wine seduces from the first sip with lush fruit and silky tannins that caress the palate and the delectably rich, multi-layered fruit is balanced by fresh acidity and complex notes of tar and an intense minerality at its core. Despite its lush palate, it is still finely delineated with perfect precision on the very long finish. A fantastic wine that is already a superstar now but these wines age really well so try to muster up every ounce of willpower to put a few of these glorious beauties in the cellar. 
.
2019 Pio Cesare, Ornato Vineyard, Barolo DOCG, Piedmont, Italy: A bright, inviting wine with lots of verve and life that presents delightful, pristine fruit such as red cherries, boysenberries and red currants that is balanced by savory herbs such as thyme with an elegant body and aromatic finish with aniseed notes. 
.
2019 Pio Cesare, Il Bricco Vineyard, Barbaresco DOCG, Piedmont, Italy: Intriguing nose of sandalwood and cinnamon stick with darker fruit and bigger structure with marked acidity, and this wine will stand up to long-term cellaring. 
.
2019 Pio Cesare, Barolo DOCG: The earthier intensity of broken rocks and, on the palate, ripe red cherries balanced by zingy cranberries with hints of spices and fresh bay leaves with lace-like tannins.
.
2019 Pio Cesare, Barbaresco DOCG: An enticing floral nose of lilacs with delicious note of warm raspberries with subtle red cherry flavor on the palate and very fine tannins.
.
2019 Pio Cesare’ Piodilei’ Chardonnay, Langhe DOC: Pretty nose with citrus blossom and stony minerality with juicy white peach flavors, crisp acidity and elegant textural contrast with broad body and fine structure that gives lift along the expressive finish.
.

Check out my latest Forbes article that was inspired by a vertical tasting led by Matthieu Bordes, general manager of @ChateauLagrange in St-Julien, Bordeaux, where the 2016, 2010, 2009, 2000, 1990 and 1982 were tasted, by going to my profile and clicking on the link.
.
2016 Château Lagrange, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux: 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Merlot and 6% Petit Verdot. An enchanting wine that dances and prances on the palate with remarkable agility and grace with an incredible bouquet of violet, sandalwood incense and forest floor notes that has a stunning purity of fruit on the palate with redcurrants and blackberries, and the silky tannins caress the palate; such a beauty.
.
2010 Château Lagrange, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux: 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Merlot. Enthralling aromas of intense minerality, fresh morel mushrooms, and an Asian spice box with broad-shouldered tannins that give lots of lift and structure to this wine and marked acidity that all give this wine an incredible depth of flavor, complexity and overall brightness along the sustained finish.
.  
2009 Château Lagrange, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux: 73% Cabernet Sauvignon and 27% Merlot. Decadent nose with cocoa nib and raspberry liqueur that has hints of dried flowers with blueberry tart flavors on the palate and silky tannins with a long, flavorful finish. 
. 
2000 Château Lagrange, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux: 76% Cabernet Sauvignon and 24% Merlot. Firm, big tannins yet with a lovely overall quality and complex layers of cigar box, graphite and fresh sage finishing with a perfumed red fruit note.
.
1990 Château Lagrange, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux: 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 44% Merlot and 12% Petit Verdot. Lots of concentration with rich cassis fruit and layers of aromas such as jasmine, smoky minerality and gravelly soil.
.
1982 Château Lagrange, Saint-Julien, Bordeaux: The exact blend is not known; smoldering cigar with sweet black cherry fruit and a touch of lushness on the mid-palate balanced by black tea notes that is still juicy with lots of fruit and lots of energy.
.

Sometimes the wines are so good you forget to take photos! So the photo credit above belongs to @QuilcedaCreek. 
.
The below Quilceda Creek, Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon is the only wine Quilceda Creek sells to the market. The other Cabernet Sauvignon wines are sold 100% to their wine club membership. 
.
2012 Quilceda Creek, Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Washington State: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon. A dark and decadent wine with black raspberry compote and blackcurrant preserves with an uplifting hint of sage that has a broad, lush palate with flavors of cocoa nibs and candied violets with round, silky tannins.  
.
2018 Quilceda Creek, Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Washington State: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon. Fresh thyme with dried wildflowers on the nose and layers of red and black fruit flavors intertwined with ribbons of silk that caress the palate and has a long, flavorful, and gorgeously textured finish that goes on and on.
.
2020 Quilceda Creek, Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, Washington State: 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from six vineyards, including Champoux and Mach One. The aromas slowly unravel teasingly as hints of freshly picked flowers, wet stones and warm red cherries each delight with blueberry and blackberry fruit flavors and a touch of spice that displays an impressive depth and concentration in harmony with an overall delicate beauty.
.
The single vineyard, single clone wines are only offered to wine club members with these. Also, the wines below were double-decanted the night before, and the suggestion for the future 2021s is to double-decant them a couple of days before and drink them on the third day. 
.

Champagne Laurent-Perrier @champagnelaurentperrier knows how to make dreams come true, and their limited-edition Cuvée Rosé with Petals Jacket takes Champagne dreams to the next level.
.
A beautiful pale pink color with tinges of salmon and fine bubbles that caress the palate. The stunningly pristine wild strawberry aromas seductively invite one into the glass with hints of toast and spice.
.
100% Grand Cru Pinot Noir grapes from 10 different villages in the North and South areas of the Montagne de Reims, as well as the famous village of Bouzy.
.

Once I think I have experienced all the beauty that a tiny producer like Minus Tide Wines @minustidewines can express with precious multi-generational vineyards in Mendocino, California, I get sent new wines that just blows me away with how they can express the multilayered nuances of these unique plots of land.
.
2021 Minus Tide, Pinot Noir, Manchester Ridge Vineyard, Mendocino Ridge AVA, Mendocino, California: 100% Pinot Noir from the Manchester Ridge Vineyard that is located at a 2,000 ft. elevation just 3.5 miles from the Pacific Ocean; dry farmed so produces small clusters with concentrated flavor and high acidity. A wildness to this wine that I love with aromas of forest floor, morels and wildflowers that dance in one's head with unbridled passion that is just mouth wateringly delicious with a stunning purity of red cherry flavor. Only 193 cases were made.
.
2021 Minus Tide, Syrah, Valenti Vineyard, Mendocino Ridge AVA, Mendocino, California: 100% Syrah from Valenti Vineyard which is located between 1,300 to 1,600 ft., six miles from the Pacific Ocean. Cooling coastal influences allow the grapes to slowly ripen, bringing more complexity, elegance and retaining bright acidity. The fantastic mingling of red strawberries with a touch of black pepper and just a hint of basil on the nose lets one know that they are about to taste a very special wine that becomes extremely delectable with a mid-palate plushiness with cassis and black raspberry liqueur flavors that are lifted by elegantly sculpted tannins and invigorated by marked acidity. Only 87 cases were made.
.
